goal:
The European Association of Institutes for Vocational Training (EVBB) is a European umbrella association whose members are state associations, associations, coordinating institutes of education, universities and educational providers at a national, regional and local level.
The work carried out by the EVBB is the qualitative improvement of vocational education and training in European countries, work with the EU Commission such as GD EMPL, CEDEFOP, GD EAC and the implementation of VET related projects. The European Association of Institutes for Vocational Training supports its members in the VET activities for young people and adults in the following areas:

Providing a liberal education in terms of social, economic and sociopolitical issues taking particular consideration of European policies and policies related to work based learning.

Promoting technical, vocational or industrial qualification, continuing education and advanced training in addition to retraining,

Promoting curricula adopted to the needs of VET providers.

Promoting qualification, continuing education and advanced training in the digital economy.

Promoting environmental qualification.

Currently the EVBB has about 60 VET providing organizations from 21 European countries, China, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, Israel and Tunisia organized in the EVBB. There is a total staff of over 35,000 working in the EVBB member associations at more than 1,500 educational centers.
Further institutions are currently being considered for membership. Hereby specific acceptance criteria are to be fulfilled.

Our members form a quality and development network and are active as project partners well beyond the borders of Europe.

The EVBB is neither politically nor denominationally affiliated. Its activities are not focused on business operations or making a profit. It serves solely and exclusively non-profit purposes within the meaning of the General Fiscal Law as it is valid in the Federal Republic of Germany.
